Pre-Game Insights: Cleveland hits the road against Dallas looking to prolong its four-game road winning streak.
The Cavaliers are 12-3 on the road.
Cleveland scores 122.4 points while outscoring opponents by 11.9 points per game.
The Mavericks' 13.4 made 3-pointers per game this season are the same per game average that the Cavaliers allow.
The Cavaliers score 11.0 more points per game (122.4) than the Mavericks allow (111.4)
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Mavericks have gone 10-5 in home games.
Dallas has a 2-4 record in games decided by 3 points or fewer.
The Mavericks' top performer is Kyrie Irving, averaging 24.3 points and 4.9 assists.
Evan Mobley is averaging 18.4 points, 8.7 rebounds and 1.5 blocks for the Cavaliers.
The Cavaliers have a strong performance in their last 10 games, averaging 123.2 points, 45.2 rebounds, 30.4 assists, 8.9 steals and 4.3 blocks per game while shooting 49.2% from the field.
The Mavericks have injuries: P.J. Washington Jr.: day to day (knee), Dante Exum: out (wrist), Luka Doncic: out (calf).
The Cavaliers have an injury: Isaac Okoro: out (shoulder)
